issue.title: `--lfnf` does nothing unless you also pass `--lf`

labels.name: type: docs
labels.description: documentation improvement, missing or needing clarification

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
this will run every test regardless of if there were any previous failures
```
pytest --lfnf=none
```
i have to pass both arguments for it to work:
```
pytest --lf --lfnf=none
```

i'm not sure if this is intended functionality for whatever reason, but if it is, it should be documented in the `--help` description. the current documentation seems a bit unclear:
```
  --lfnf={all,none}, --last-failed-no-failures={all,none}
                        Which tests to run with no previously (known) failures
```

body: I can work on this if that is ok

issue.title: docs: changing some docs for last-failed-no-failures

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
* Made the functionality of last-failed-no-failures more clear within the docs

closes #11354 
Change is trivial/a small documentation fix, so no changes to changelog.

body:
@nicoddemus 
Made a PR here: https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/pull/11357
Pre-commit may fail cause of these two issues: 
- #11343
- #11356

Feel free to let me know if I should make any edits or changes
Hi @seanjedi, as I commented in the PR, the idea is to change the documentation, not the command-line help message. Would appreciate if you give this another go!
If we can improve on both certainly!
